case_title: GHULAM HUSSAIN SHAH vs GHULAM MUHAMMAD
reference_no_or_id: Civil Miscellaneous No. 948/S of 1964/BWP Regular First Appeal No. 6 of 1962

accussed_details.name: Ghulam Hussain Shah
allegation: Claimed half share in land purchased jointly with Ghulam Muhammad

complaint_summary: Ghulam Hussain Shah claimed joint ownership of 800 kanals of land purchased by Ghulam Muhammad, alleging benami transaction due to restrictions on government servants owning land.
investigation_summary: The dispute involved ownership of land purchased in 1947. Ghulam Muhammad applied for confirmation under the Pakistan (Administration of Evacuee Property) Act. Ghulam Hussain Shah contested the mutation, citing a joint purchase agreement and subsequent payments under a Panchayat settlement.
judgment_summary: The court certified the case as fit for appeal to the Supreme Court, involving substantial questions of law regarding constitutional interpretation and res judicata principles. Ghulam Muhammad's claim to ownership based on a relinquishment agreement was upheld.
Decision_or_verdict: Case certified for appeal to the Supreme Court; substantial question of law identified.
legal_arguments: Constructive res judicata under Section 11, Explanation IV of CPC
Applicability of Section 53-A of the Transfer of Property Act
Jurisdiction under Articles 58 and 60 of the 1962 Constitution
sections: Section 53-A of the Transfer of Property Act
citations: Hussain Bakhsh v. Settlement Commissioner, Rawalpindi

witness_statement.Sheikh Khairuddin: Acted as surety for payment of Rs. 21,750.
witness_statement.Chowdhry Shukardin: Held Rs. 3,250 deposit payable to Ghulam Hussain Shah.

appeal_number: Civil Petition for Special Leave to Appeal No. 4/1966
key_issues: Ownership dispute over 800 kanals of land
Interpretation of constitutional provisions regarding appellate jurisdiction

maxims.Res judicata: No court shall try any suit or issue already decided between the same parties.

legal_terms.Benami: Transaction where property is purchased in another's name.
legal_terms.Mutation: Transfer of ownership in revenue records.

words_and_phrases.Constructive res judicata: Preclusion of claims that could have been raised in earlier litigation.

summary_vector_notes: Ownership dispute over 800 kanals of land resolved through litigation. Ghulam Muhammad's claim upheld based on agreement and payments. Res judicata principles and constitutional interpretation central to case.
